Rod.name:
##Name## arrives today at our office located at 24 Bradley Avenue on Staten Island, for review of diagnostic studies. The patient has been treating at our office since ##IEdate## for injuries sustained in a ##cause## that occurred on ##DOA##. The patient was recently re-evaluated on ##FUVisitdate## at which time a full evaluation was performed inclusive of range of motions and neurological examination. Today the patient arrives for review the testing only.
The patient underwent the following studies with results as follows:
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the cervical spine reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the thoracic spine reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the lumbar spine reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the head/brain reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the left knee reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the right knee revealed
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the left wrist reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the right shoulder reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the left wrist reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the left ankle reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the right ankle reveals
On ___mm/dd/yy___ MRI study of the _________ reveals
The above-referenced test results were reviewed with the patient.
Plan:

I recommend that the patient be scheduled for EMG/NCV studies of the bilateral upper extremities, to assess for the anatomical cause of the patient's continued decrease in motion of the cervical spine, as well as the persistent neurological deficits and continued pain, all noted on the recent re-evaluation that occurred on ##DOA##. Once the testing is obtained and reviewed, this will assist in deciding the most beneficial future plan of treatment for the patient by means of pain management interventions versus neurosurgical intervention. The patient is scheduled for a routine re-evaluation on ___mm/dd/yy___, but understands should he/she need to see me sooner, he/she may phone the office at any time to move up their appointment.

I recommend that the patient be scheduled for EMG/NCV studies of the bilateral lower extremities, to assess for the anotomical cause of the patient's continued decrease in motion of the lumbar spine, as well as the patient's has persistent neurological deficits and continued pain, all noted on the recent re-evaluation that occurred on ##DOA##. Once the testing is obtained and reviewed, this will assist in deciding the most beneficial future plan of treatment for the patient by means of pain management interventions versus neurosurgical intervention. The patient is scheduled for a routine re-evaluation on __mm/dd/yy__, but understands should he/she need to see me sooner, he/she may phone the office at any time to move up their appointment.
I recommend that the patient consult with a neurologist for traumatic brain injury.
I recommend that the patient consult with an orthopedic surgeon for the left knee.
I recommend that the patient consult with an orthopedic surgeon for the right knee.
I recommend that the patient consult with an orthopedic surgeon for the left shoulder.
I recommend that the patient consult with an orthopedic surgeon for the right shoulder.
I recommend the patient consult with an ankle specialist for the left ankle.
I recommend the patient consult with an ankle specialist for the right ankle.
I recommend that the patient consult with a wrist/ hand specialist for the left wrist/hand.
I recommend that the patient consult with a wrist/ hand specialist for the right wrist/hand.
